summary:
Palm oil is a vegetable oil made from the fruit of oil palms, used in food, beauty products, and biofuel. It's popular because it keeps food fresh and tastes good. In 2015, people worldwide ate about 7.7 kg (17 lbs) of palm oil each.

However, making palm oil can hurt the environment and people's rights, leading to deforestation and social issues. A group called the Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil tries to make production better, but some critics say it's not enough.

Indonesia is the biggest producer, making 60% of the world's palm oil in 2022.
title: Palm oil
